reviews.text: We used this hotel recently as a stop over back from Spain. I picked it due to the fact it was by the railway station and secondly because of the high ratings on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Great for the railway station, not a lot else.
Easy for Travellers
reviews.text: This is in fact two hotels "comfort" and "quality" that share a number of facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the "comfort" part. This is a budget hotel so do t expect too much. It is pretty new and is extremely bland. Everything is white, it looks more like a hospital than a hotel. Some people may like white everywhere, we didn't really. Especially as the bedroom walls are white apart from a couple of spacemen and a rocket painted on them. Strange.
reviews.title: excellent quality/price ratio

reviews.text: Perpignan is ok for a night or two but there is not a lot to do to be honest
reviews.title: Perfect hotel stay!!

reviews.text: The walk to the town centre takes about 15 minutes down a street litered with kebabs shops. There are a number of restaurants in the town centre and most appeared busy. We ate at "Roma" restaurant which was nice and good value.
reviews.title: Perfect for a train station stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is such good value. The hotel is situated within walking distance of the town, has very convenient parking on site (Euro10), and has pleasant, friendly staff. Our room was a great size with a lovely large bed, views of the mountains, lovely shower, and everything was absolutely spotless. The breakfast was quite adequate.
reviews.title: Great value and pleasant hotel

reviews.text: Our only complaint was that the air conditioning in the room blew directly onto the bed, making it impossible to sleep with it on. Perhaps we were unaware of how to redirect the fan?
reviews.title: Clean, modern, friendly hotel

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Marvelous Magalie and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good and room very clean.
reviews.title: Overnight in Central Perpignan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like a modern, and new looking hotel, check this one out!
reviews.title: great room, great location

reviews.text: 3 of us stayed here for 2 nights while in town for the rugby. We arrived by train so ideal as right there and about a 15 to 20 minute walk into the centre. It is a bit awkward to get back to the hotel later at night after the shopping centre has closed as the main entrance is on the far side of the station from the town so an extra walk around. There seems to be more work going on so perhaps this will be rectified in time. If you need supplies there is a well stocked supermarket in the shopping centre and a Subway etc. Having stayed in Perpignan previously on a couple of occasions this hotel was easily the best experience. The staff were friendly and didn't have any language problems with us, the rooms were quiet and comfortable and we all slept very well in our rooms on the 4th floor. Would definitely stay here again as the quality and freshness of the hotel more than makes up for not being in the town centre plus its great for onward travel. All in all good value for the quality and comfort. One of the two lifts was out of order so some delays there at times but ok if you are able to use stairs as an alternative.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable,quiet and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The small modern bar is in the reception area and staffed 24 hours if required.
reviews.title: Very modern

reviews.text: We stayed here on Bastille day. It is a very clean, modern hotel. The location is ideal if you arrive by train as it is in the station complex itself. However, don't let that put you off as you would not know it when you are in the modern, stylish room. Getting into the town is easy during the day and early evening, but the shortcut through the station closes mid evening and this means a longish detour on foot. Great value for money.
reviews.title: new hotel, perfect for sleep-over before catching train

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel before catching a train in the morning in Perpignan, so the location was perfect, as it is located inside a kind of mall connected to the train station. The hotel is brand new, so the room and bathroom were very nice, modern, and clean. There are two breakfast options, leaving you the choice to avoid the expensive buffet if you're in a hurry or not very hungry. The full buffet is not worth the price I think. The staff was friendly, but definitely not very fluent in languages other than french (not a problem for me, but I heard some funny conversations between reception staff and some english clients...). There's also free wifi.
reviews.title: Brill for train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very clean and lots of space in bathroom.we did go out to a pub for something to eat but they were lots of unclean people walking about.then to top it off we went to the shop over the road lidl there were drunks outside and when we were coming out someone got stopped for shoplifting not a place to be alone
reviews.title: Spacey Comfort

reviews.text: We booked 3 months in advance and got a great non-refundable deal at 60euros for a twin. Literally situated at the Gare, the Hotel is very clean, room is of good size, bright, and service efficient. The only "down" side is that there is no kettle in the room and the lobby bar (which was served by the reception in the evening we stayed in) was not properly stocked with hot drinks. We are however very satisfied with our stay and won't hesitate to recommend to fellow travelers.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Nice tidy clean hotel . Secure parking is a plus and is within easy walking distance of Perpignan town centre . Breakfast was a buffet type but of a good standard and the smoking deck on the second floor is quite plush .
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Found the breakfast rather expensive at 15euros (continental) the staff were friendly and helpful,rooms were clean and tidy,nice shower and decor,very modern just a shame it was situated in this position,not easy to get back to at night,quite intimidating with the subway and the undesirable people lurking around and for this reason i wouldnt visit again,I fully agree with nutmeg 06 review.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but rough area around station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quirky decor livens up an otherwise straightforward, modern hotel. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Good air-conditioning and very quiet considering it's next to a railway station and a main road. It's very convenient for 1 euro bus network http://www.cg66.fr/553-plan-et-horaires.htm#par14359. There's a supermarket in the attached shopping arcade and the hotel rooms have small fridges.
reviews.title: Like Ibis but with style

reviews.text: The walk to the centre of Perpignan takes at least 10 minutes and the area immediately around the railway station is a bit rough - however ask reception to show you a route following the canal, it's a bit more scenic.
reviews.title: futuristic decor in rooms
